law.catch_line: Sec. 2-1481. Creation of the South Miami-Dade Development Agency
law.text: There is hereby created and established as an instrumentality of Miami-Dade County an agency which shall be named and known as the South Miami-Dade Development Agency (hereinafter referred to as the "Agency"). The Agency may exercise all those powers either specifically granted herein or necessary in the exercise of the powers herein enumerated.

text.section:
Membership. Members of the Agency shall serve without compensation. The voting membership, reflecting the ethnic, racial, and gender diversity of Miami-Dade County, shall be composed of the designated representatives of each of the following organizations:
Chamber South
Perrine Cutler Ridge Council
Vision Council
Greater Homestead/Florida City Chamber of Commerce
Everglades National Park
Biscayne National Park
Tropical Everglades Visitor Association
City of Homestead
City of Florida City
Empowerment Zone-Florida City Neighborhood Assembly
Empowerment Zone-Homestead Neighborhood Assembly
West Perrine CDC
Goulds CDC
Naranja-Princeton CDC
South Miami Heights CDC
Princeton CDC
Leisure City OCED
Haitian Organization for Women
Unique Coalition of Minority Businesses (UCOMB)
Greater Miami Convention and Visitors Bureau
Cutler Ridge Business Improvement District
Naranja Lakes Community Redevelopment Agency
Park of Commerce (Rockefeller Group)

Dade County Farm Bureau
Everglades Coalition
Beacon Council

Coalition of Florida Farmworkers Organizations
Dade County Public Schools Region 5
Dade County Public Schools Region 6
Miami-Dade Community College-Homestead Campus
Job Corps
University of Miami
Florida International University
University of Florida
Urban Land Institute/Southeast Council
Newly Incorporated Municipalities within the geographic boundaries of this article
Board of County Commission District Eight Office (ex officio)
Board of County Commission District Nine Office (ex officio)
South Miami-Dade State Legislative Districts (ex officio)
Miami-Dade County Mayor's Office (ex officio)
South Miami-Dade Congressional Districts (ex officio)
City of Palmetto Bay If any Member's designated representative also holds a federal, state, or local elected office, that representative shall serve in an ex officio capacity. No person may serve simultaneously as the designated representative for more than one Member. Additional Members may be added as set forth in the by-laws. Vacancies shall be filled in the same manner by which the original representatives were appointed, with a special emphasis on choosing persons representative of the gender, racial and ethnic composition of the entire community.
Removal of Members. Members and designated representatives may be removed in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 2-11.38 of the Code of Miami-Dade County.
Tenure. Terms shall be established by the Agency by-laws.
Qualifications. Each Member and designated representative must comply with the requirements of Chapter 2-11.38 of the Code of Miami-Dade County.

Organization and procedure.
Officers. The Agency shall organize after the Members and designated representatives thereof have qualified to serve and shall elect one (1) of its representatives as chairperson and such other officers as may be necessary. In addition, the Agency shall make, adopt and amend by-laws, rules and regulations for its own governance.
Meetings. The Agency shall hold regular meetings and such other meetings as it deems necessary. Quorum shall be defined in the Agency by-laws. Minutes shall be kept of all meetings and all meetings shall be public.
Committees. The Agency shall appoint any committees it deems necessary.

law.catch_line: Sec. 2-1483. Applicability of County rules and procedures
law.text: The Agency shall at all times operate under the Florida Open Government laws, including the "Sunshine Law," public meeting laws and public records laws and shall be governed by all State and County conflict of interest laws, as applicable, including the Miami-Dade County Conflict of Interest and Code of Ethics Ordinance, Section 2-11.1 of the Code of Miami-Dade County.
Designated Representatives may not in turn designate alternates to serve and/or vote on their behalf.

The Agency shall have the following powers, duties, functions and responsibilities:
To serve in an advisory capacity to the Board of County Commissioners with respect to all issues affecting economic development in South Miami-Dade County.
To serve in an advisory capacity to the Board of County Commissioners with respect to implementation of the Homestead Reuse Plan.
To recommend expenditure of funds either derived from or allocated to the reuse of the former Homestead Air Force Base surplus property.
To serve as a clearinghouse of information regarding South Miami-Dade County economic development.
To encourage economic development initiatives in South Miami-Dade County from Southwest 152 Street to the Monroe County line.

The Agency shall select, with the approval of the County Manager, a full-time Executive Director. The Clerk of the Board shall record all meetings and the County Manager shall provide adequate funding, staff and support services to enable the Agency to carry out its duties and responsibilities.
